title: Pmalek
author: Pmalek
created_time: October 10, 2022, 07:22:54 PMLast edit: October 11, 2022, 01:02:07 PM by Pmalek
content: Ledger started a one-week discount campaign where you can get free shipping on your Nano S Plus or Nano X purchases starting today. The offer is valid until 17 October and doesn't require the entry of a discount code during checkout.  Halloween is coming up and maybe there will be other promotions and discounts from hardware wallet manufacturers. Due to the current state of the economy and the everlasting chip shortage, I doubt we will see big discounts. Offers such as free shipping or free accessories might be the best they can offer for now.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I agree with you, it is highly unlikely we will see considerable offers for hardware wallets this black friday. It is a pity, I would love to take  the chance to save some money in a good wallet but it appears this year will be about the same as the last one, in the case of Trezor and Ledger.On the other hand, if the online electronic shops have good enough offers for their components it would be a good chance to build one's own hardware wallet, like the Trezor Raspberry Pi.What are the chances some less recognized hardware wallet makers take advantage of the lack of offers and manage to pull off their own discounts for the sake of advertisement?

comments.author: jerry0
comments.body: I saw this message as well.  How much does shipping cost now?  There is regular shipping and express shipping right?  I remember when I ordered it a while back, it was express shipping and got it in few days.How many business days is it free shipping vs expedited shipping?Also everyone has to pay tax regardless of whichever country they are from right?

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on October 10, 2022, 08:30:53 PMWhat are the chances some less recognized hardware wallet makers take advantage of the lack of offers and manage to pull off their own discounts for the sake of advertisement?There are certainly hardware wallets that have done well out of being cheap (a lot of them are probably of good enough security that they can still be relied upon to have a similar level as trezor and ledger).This seems like a strange offer considering they have official stores on sites like amazon and are able to offer free delivery via them (unless there's an additional price factored in somewhere that covers delivery from them to a distribution place).

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on October 10, 2022, 08:30:53 PMWhat are the chances some less recognized hardware wallet makers take advantage of the lack of offers and manage to pull off their own discounts for the sake of advertisement? They are sill in the same mess like everyone else. It's even harder to make a decent profit for smaller companies that can't rely on quantity to stay competitive. It's easier to lower the price if you sell 200.000 units a year compared to only 5.000. Inflation, material and chip shortages don't make it easy for anyone.  Quote from: jackg on October 11, 2022, 03:28:23 AMThis seems like a strange offer considering they have official stores on sites like amazon and are able to offer free delivery via them (unless there's an additional price factored in somewhere that covers delivery from them to a distribution place). I think free delivery is only for Amazon Prime customers. You don't enjoy free shipping just because you are buying over Amazon, do you? Amazon Prime subscription fee is about $15 a month the last time I checked. So even though the shipping itself is free, you are paying that money for something else.

Maybe I'm wrong about the recent past, but I'm sure I haven't paid any additional costs for my devices in the past.I think that, like every year, there will be some discount for Black Friday or before Christmas/New Year, but I don't believe that it will be more than 20%, realistically probably 10%.

comments.body: Quote from: m2017 on October 11, 2022, 12:39:40 PMFree shipping Ledger's hardware wallets for this promotion applies to all types of delivery, including economy and express delivery? Good question. I didn't think about that and the fact there are different shipping methods. From what I can see, it's not express delivery. Outside of EU 14-21.   Quote from: m2017 on October 11, 2022, 12:39:40 PMAlso, it would be good to indicate the source of this information. comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on October 11, 2022, 12:00:45 PM@Lucius didn't you order your Nano X with a discount during Black Friday or something? Maybe free shipping was part of that promotion.  I bought X right on the Black Friday discount, and the total discount was 35%, with the fact that the basic discount was 30%, and then on the last day they added another 5%. If I remember correctly, the total amount was about $90, and the shipping costs were free, as you can see from what I wrote in this little review.I think it's hard to expect something like that to happen again, because not only did I buy the device at a 35% lower price and get free shipping, but I also didn't have to pay any additional customs costs because I'm in the EU. For people who want to order directly from the manufacturer and live outside the EU, this is a good opportunity to save at least on delivery.
